Set.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Young Pioneers[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Local Happiness from every Workshop, Factory, Hydro Plant, Steel Foundry, Nuclear Plant, and Solar Plant.

Row.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Workers' Faculties[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Factories increase a City's [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output by 25%. Build Factories and Steel Foundries in half the usual time.

Set.Text: Botanical Gardens provide +2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in city
Theatres provide +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith in cities with 3 followers

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Party Leadership[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Strategic Resources provide double quantity. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science per City.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Skyscrapers[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_GOLD] Gold cost of purchasing buildings reduced by 33%. +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food in the Capital.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Third Alternative[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Strategic Resrouces provide double quantity. +5 [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and [ICON_RESEARCH] Science in the Capital.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Arsenal of Democracy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Strategic Resrouces provide double quantity. +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards Military Units. Gain 15 Influence from each Military Unit gift to CIty-States.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercantilism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Purchasing items in Cities requires 25% less [ICON_GOLD] Gold. +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from every Mint, Market, Bank, Casino, and Stock Exchange.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Capitalism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Local Happiness from every Mint, Bank, Casino, and Stock Exchange.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Universal Suffrage[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages last 75% longer. -15% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in non-occupied Cities.

+2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for each City you own connected to the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital and -10% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in non-occupied Cities. Specialists in Cities produce half the normal amount of [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness.
Each city you found will increase the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost of policies by 40% less than normal. Also starts a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age (if one is already in progress, it is extended).

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Colonialism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from all your Sea Trade Routes. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] New Cities start with an extra 1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population, +5% [ICON_FOOD] Food from Harbors.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Navigation School[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] A Great Admiral appears. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +2 [ICON_MOVES] Movement for all Great Admirals and +1 for embarked units. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +5% [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Seaports.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Maritime Infrastructure[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in all coastal Cities.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +25% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when constructing Lighthouses, Harbors, and Seaports.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Scientific Revolution[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Boosts [ICON_RESEARCH] Science gained from research agreements by 50%.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +10% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Public Schools.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Reduces the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost of future Policies by 5%.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Humanism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Great Scientists are earned 25% faster. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Cities with Public Schools gain +5% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.

Replace.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Artistic Genius[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] A Great Artist appears. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Large Towns.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +1 [ICON_RESEARnce from Artifacts and [ICON_GREAT_WORK] Great Works.

Set.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]FINE ARTS[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]100% of excess [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness added each turn to the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture that may be spent on Social Policies.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cultural Exchange[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Increases the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism modifier for Shared Religion, Trade Routes, and Open Borders by 15% each.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Artifacts and [ICON_GREAT_WORK] Great Works.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Flourishing of the Arts[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [ICON_CULTURE] Culture increased by 25% in all Cities which have built a World Wonder.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +10% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Public Schools.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Starts a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age.

Replace.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aesthetics[ENDCOLOR] improves the civilization's ability to generate [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Adopting Aesthetics grants:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Earn Great Writers, Artists and Musicians 25% faster.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Allows you to build Guilds in half the usual time.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Unlocks the [COLOR_WATER_TEXT]Uffizi[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Adopting all policies in Aesthetics grants:[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Allows you to see Hidden Antiquity Sites.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Doubles the theming bonus you receive from Museums and Wonders.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Allows the purchase of [ICON_GREAT_WRITER] Great Writers, [ICON_GREAT_ARTIST] Artists, or [ICON_GREAT_MUSICIAN] Musicians with [ICON_PEACE] Faith starting in the Industrial Era.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Reduces the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost of future Policies by 20%.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercenary Army[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Allows the purchasing of [COLOR_YELLOW]Landsknechts[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][ICON_GOLD] Gold cost of purchasing units reduced by 17%.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Professional Army[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Barracks, Armories, and Military Academies are constructed 50% faster.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Unit Maintenance cost reduced by 10%.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Military Caste[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Each City with a garrison increases empire [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness by 1 and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture by 2. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Gain +3 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from the Heroic Epic.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Reformation[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]If you founded a religion, gain a bonus Reformation belief.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Reduces the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost of future Policies by 10%.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mandate of Heaven[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]20% discount on all purchases of religious units and buildings with [ICON_PEACE] Faith.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for every Temple.

Set.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Merchant Confederacy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for trade routes with City-States.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every Caravansary.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cultural Diplomacy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Quantity of Resources gifted by City-States increased by 100%. [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from gifted Luxuries increased by 50%.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for every Caravansary.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Scholasticism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All City-States which are [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Allies[ENDCOLOR] provide a [ICON_RESEARCH] Science bonus equal to 25% of what they produce for themselves.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+10% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science from Caravansaries.

Replace.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Entrepreneurship[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Great Merchants are earned 25% faster. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Receive double [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Great Merchant trade missions.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +10% [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Stock Exchange.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Mercenary Army[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Allows the purchasing of Landsknechts.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Reduce unit purchase cost by 15%.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Oligarchy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Cities with a garrison gain +50% [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Garrisoned units cost no maintenance.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +40% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building Walls, and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] from Castles.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Landed Elite[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] +18% [ICON_FOOD] Growth and +5 [ICON_FOOD] Food in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.

Set.Text: +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building Wonders (any Era) and +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for every 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in a City.
+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness for every [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tradition[ENDCOLOR] is best for small empires.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Tradition greatly increases the rate of border expansion in cities and also grants 3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. Unlocks building the Hanging Gardens.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Tradition tree will grant [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+15% [ICON_FOOD] Growth and a free Aqueduct in your first 4 cities.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Allows the purchase of Great Engineers with [ICON_PEACE] Faith starting in the Industrial Era.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]-1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness for every [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
